thread.title: India and EU give WTO lists of US goods for potential tariff retaliation

title: India and EU give WTO lists of US goods for potential tariff retaliation
text:
May 18, 2018 / 4:37 PM / Updated 15 minutes ago India and EU give WTO lists of US goods for potential tariff retaliation Reuters Staff 1 Min Read
GENEVA (Reuters) - India and the European Union have given the World Trade Organization lists of the U.S. products that could incur high tariffs in retaliation for U.S. President Donald Trump’s global tariffs on steel and aluminium, WTO filings showed on Friday. FILE PHOTO: People are pictured in the headquarters of the World Trade Organization (WTO) in Geneva, Switzerland, April 12, 2017. REUTERS/Denis Balibouse
The EU said Trump’s steel tariffs could cost $1.5 billion (1.1 billion pounds) and aluminium tariffs a further $100 million, and listed rice, cranberries, bourbon, corn, peanut butter, and steel products among the U.S. goods that it might target for retaliation.
India said it was facing additional U.S. tariffs of $31 million on aluminium and $134 million on steel, and listed U.S. exports of soya oil, palmolein and cashew nuts among its potential targets for retaliatory tariffs. Reporting by Tom Miles; Editing by Catherine Evans
